snippet: At least one survivor was rescued after a helicopter went down in a rugged area of southern Afghanistan. Afghan officials cited possible mechanical trouble.
abstract: Six American soldiers die when their helicopter crashes in remote area of southern Afghanistan, single largest loss of life for foreign troops in nearly six months.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed reported from Kabul, and Thom Shanker from Washington. Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: At least one survivor was rescued after a helicopter went down in a rugged area of southern Afghanistan. Afghan officials cited possible mechanical trouble.

headline.main: 6 U.S. Soldiers Killed in Crash of Helicopter in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 6 U.S. Soldiers Killed in Crash of Helicopter in Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
